div.l: Allas qduod she I had almost mys gon̄4218
I had almost gon to þᵉ clerkes bed
Ey benedicite þan had I foule spede4220
And forth she goth þ̉ere she þᵉ cradell fond
She gropeth alwey forþer wᵗith her hand
And fond þᵉ bed ⁊and þoult not but good
By cause þᵗat þᵉ cradul by hit stod
And wyst not whare she was for hit was derk4225
And fayre ⁊and well she crepeth in to þᵉ clerk
And lyth ful stylle ⁊and wolde haue cauht a slep
Wᵗith Inne a whyle þis Iohn þᵉ cleerk vp lep
And on þis gode wyfe he leyth on sore
So mery a fitte had she not ful ȝore4230
He pⁱrikketh hard ⁊and depe as he were mad
Þis Ioly lyf haue þese clerkes lad
Tyl þᵗat þᵉ þridde cok began to synge
Aleyn wex wery in þᵉ dawenynge
For he had swonken al þᵉ longe nyth4235
And seyde fare wel malyn my swete whyth
Þᵉ day is come I may no lengeer abyde
But eủermore where so I go or ryde
I am þyn owne clerk so haue I sele
Now dere swete go fare well4240
But or þᵘou go oo þyng I wyl þe tell
When þᵘou wendest homward by þᵉ myll
Ryth at þᵉ entre of þᵉ mylle dore behynde
Þᵘou shalt a cake of half a busshel fynde
That was ymad of þyn owne mele
Þᵉ wych I halp my syre to stele
And gode lemman god þe saue ⁊and kepe 4247
